document.docTitle: Oligonychus camelliae Ehara & Gotoh, 2007, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Five species of spider mites (Acari: Prostigmata: Tetranychidae) from Japan with descriptions of two new species

Type series.
Holotype male (NSMT-Ac 12444 ): Shinobuyama, Fukushima, Fukishima Pref., Honshu,
13 May 2000
(T. Gotoh & Y. Kitashima leg.), on
Camellia japonica
L. ( Theaceae ). Paratypes :
6 males
(NSMT- Ac 12445-12450 ) &
10 females
(NSMT-Ac 12451-12452 ),
3 males
&
5 females
(KUM), data same as for holotype .

Remarks. The female of the new species resembles that of a Japanese species
Oligonychus ilicis (McGregor, 1917 )
, but differs in having the dorsal idiosomal setae not arising from tubercles, and setae f 2 about 4 / 5 the length of f 1 . This species is also similar to
O. letchworthi
Reeves, 1963
from New York State but is reddish brown in color, while the latter is green (
Reeves, 1963
).

Etymology. This species is named after the generic name of the host plant,
Camellia
.
